facts:
His daughter raised alarm and somehow managed to come out from the clutches of the accused.
Receiving the same, the police registered a case and investigated the matter.
After vy oF investigation, the police submitted charge sheet against the accused person u/s 8 of the seo POCSO Act.

yo 3. The accused in due course appeared before this court to face trial.
The copies of the relevant documents were furnished to him.
Upon hearing both the sides on the point of charge, taking note of the materials furnished u/s 173 CrPC as this court found grounds for  Page 2 of 4 Spl. POCSO No. 26/2018 presuming that the accused has committed an offence u/s 8 of the POCSO Act, the charge was accordingly framed against him, which on being read over and explained, the accused pleaded not guilty.
4. During trial, the prosecution examined seven witnesses in all including the Investigating Officer as PW 7.
As no incriminating evidence was found against the accused his examination u/s 313 CrPC was dispensed with.
The case was thereafter, argued by both the sides.
PW 1 is the informant and the father of the alleged victim, namely, Sri Phatik Nath.

According to him, the incident took place on 26.06.2018.
The victim after returning back from the school stated to them that when a meeting was going on in her school, she came to her Class room to drink water.
The accused then came there and touched her chest.
ANALYSIS:
p Thus from the evidence of all the prosecution witnesses, more particularly, from the evidence of PW 2- the victim, we do not find any reliable evidence against the accused to convict him on the offence charged against him.
The prosecution has failed to prove its case.
decision:
As such I acquit the accused person from the offence charged against him and set him liberty forthwith.
His bail bond stands discharged.
A copy of the judgment be forwarded to the District Magistrate, sonitpur in compliance with the sec. 365 Cr.P.C.: The case is disposed of.
